results.title: Le Beau Serge = Handsome Serge
results.creator_credit: Jean Cotet, Ajym Films and Claude Chabrol
results.brief_description:
After 10 years away, Francois returns to the village where he grew up and meets up again with old friend Serge. Serge used to be the envy of all because of his intelligence and beauty, but he is now only a shadow of his former self. Married to Yvonne, Serge has become an alcoholic after the couple lost their child. Francois is willing to do anything to help his friend and the two protagonists indulge in a transfer of personal guilt, then an ‘exchange of redemption’. ‘Le beau Serge’ was the first film of French critic-turned-director Claude Chabrol and is widely acknowledged as the first film of the French New Wave. Though not a murder melodrama, the film is heavily influenced by the works of Chabrol’s idol Alfred Hitchcock, ‘Shadow of a Doubt’ in particular. Two of the principal actors - Jean-Claude Brialy and Gerard Blain - also appear in Chabrol’s follow-up film, ‘Les Cousins’. Also available on VHS.

Credits: Producer, Jean Cotet ; director, writer, Claude Chabrol ; photography, Henri Decae ; music, Emile Delpierre, Geo Legros ; assistant directors, Philippe de Broca, Claude de Givray, Claude Cerval.
Cast: Gerard Blain, Jean-Claude Brialy, Bernadette Lafont, Claude Chabrol, Philippe de Broca, Michele Meritz, Jeanne Perez, Edmond Beauchamps.

results.title: Le Battant = the Cache
results.creator_credit: Adel Productions, AMLF and Alain Delon
results.brief_description:
As soon as he is released from jail, Jacques Darnay is being followed by Commissioner Rouxel. Darnay has spent 5 years inside for a jewellery heist and Rouxel hopes Darnay is going to lead him to the cache.

Credits: Producer, director, Alain Delon ; writers, Alain Delon, Christopher Frank ; photography, Jean Tournier ; music, Christian Dorisse, Michel Colombier.
Cast: Alain Delon, Francois Perier, Pierre Mondy, Anne Parillaud, Andrea Ferreol, Jean-Francois Garreaud, Richard Anconina, Michel Beaune.

results.title: Lazy Sunday afternoon
results.brief_description: In the desert a vulture enjoys the silence of a hot afternoon. The sudden appearance of a vehicle destroys the quiet of the day. Two pistoleros exit the car ready for a duel; our hero, the vulture, watches as the pistoleros take part in a very funny slow motion shoot-out.

results.title: Lazy rhythms
results.brief_description: The Mills Brothers Musical Film Revue perform three songs in three different settings: Lazy River (2:33 mins), Rockin’ Chair (3:00 mins), Till Then (2:45 mins).

results.title: Layout and handling in factories
results.brief_description: The effect on production costs, time and workers’ well-being of imperfect factory layout. Various examples show that regrouping of existing equipment and the addition of new can significantly increase productivity and repay capital outlay.
results.description: The effect on production costs, time and workers’ well-being of imperfect factory layout. Various examples show that regrouping of existing equipment and the addition of new can significantly increase productivity and repay capital outlay.

results.title: Laying it on the line
results.creator_credit: R and R Productions, Victorian Film Corporation and Ron V. Brown
results.brief_description: Gives a general overview of the method of planning excavation, laying and testing of two types of drainage materials - stoneware and PVC pipes. The need for correct installation methods current with present procedures are clearly shown.

results.title: Lay lady lay
results.creator_credit: Kratky Film, J. Hekrdla and Vladimir Jirawck
results.brief_description: Presents a clever, animated statement on morale and productivity, two key problems in every business field. An overworked hen is rejuvenated after a visit to her company psychiatrist.

results.title: Lay it on the line: a study in campaign fire management
results.brief_description: Through a lecture, to a group of firemen, and footage shot during an actual fire in California, the film explains what must be done by various people to contain fires of different sizes.

results.title: Laxton
results.creator_credit: AVC Productions and University of Hull
results.brief_description: The story of Laxton, a village in Nottinghamshire, and its evolution from Norman times, showing how strip farming operated. Shows how a medieval management system fits into the modern agricultural scene. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
